lines.author: Uncle
lines.text: Oh, hello dear. Sorry, I was absorved in my own thoughts.

lines.author: Uncle
lines.text: Oh nothing much... To be completely honest with you, I don't feel like being at this party at the moment.

lines.author: Clara
lines.text: That makes two of us. I'm not in the slightest mood for this party. But my parents insisted that I should come anyways...

lines.author: Uncle
lines.text: Hahaha I see it's the same for you as it was for me. My sister, your Mother, insisted I attend.

lines.author: Uncle
lines.text: "You should come! Come on, it could be your chance to meet someone new!" she said.

lines.author: Uncle
lines.text: So far no luck. Maybe I should put on a friendly face... Bah, I don't feel like it.

lines.author: Clara
lines.text: It's just that you're being funny right now! And it feels good knowing that I'm not alone.

lines.author: Uncle
lines.text: Glad I could get a smile out of you dear. Maybe this night isn't so bad after all.

lines.author: Clara
lines.text: (Talking with Uncle always puts me in a better mood... Shall I try greeting the other guests now?)
